meanings.definition: A person who is easily influenced or manipulated.
meanings.sent1: She's such a softhead, always believing everything she hears.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a softhead and fall for their tricks.
meanings.sent3: The softhead thought the email from the prince asking for money was real.
meanings.sent4: Being a softhead in this world can lead to trouble.
meanings.sent5: He was known as the softhead of the group, easily swayed by others.

meanings.definition: To act in a foolish or naive manner.
meanings.sent1: Don't softhead your way through life; think before you act.
meanings.sent2: She tends to softhead when it comes to making important decisions.
meanings.sent3: He softheaded his way into trouble by trusting strangers too easily.
meanings.sent4: Softheading through challenges won't lead to success.
meanings.sent5: If you softhead your way through the test, you'll likely make mistakes.
